context: CEO and sole owner of Sisu Capital LLC, a California investment advisory firm. Subject of a 2023 SEC enforcement action for securities fraud. Also co-owns Arcata Theatre Lounge via Joseppi's LLC. Son of Hansueli 'Hans' Overturf, himself a former financial advisor with an extensive regulatory history.

expected_facts.fact: Timothy Overturf full legal name is Timothy Silas Prugh Overturf
Timothy Overturf is a resident of Arcata California
Timothy Overturf born approximately 1995 was 28 years old at time of 2023 SEC complaint
Timothy Overturf was 18 years old when he founded Sisu Capital in October 2013
Sisu Capital LLC was founded in October 2013 by Timothy Overturf
Timothy Overturf is the sole legal owner and CEO of Sisu Capital
Timothy Overturf served as Chief Compliance Officer of Sisu Capital from 2016 to 2018 and again in 2021
Sisu Capital was registered as investment adviser with State of California from November 2014 to December 2020
Sisu Capital registration was revoked by State of California in January 2021
Timothy Overturf continued advising clients after Sisu registration was revoked
Sisu Capital served approximately 42 high-net-worth clients with assets under management up to 51.7 million dollars
Sisu Capital principal place of business was in Mill Valley California
Sisu charged clients annual fee 2% of assets under management plus 20% performance fee
SEC filed complaint August 2023 in federal court San Francisco charging Sisu Capital Timothy Overturf and Hansueli Hans Overturf
SEC charged Sisu Capital and Timothy Overturf with violating antifraud provisions Sections 206(1) and 206(2) of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940
Hans Overturf was charged with aiding and abetting his son Timothy violations
SEC alleged violations occurred from December 2017 through at least May 2021
SEC alleges Sisu Capital allowed Hans Overturf to give investment advice to clients while Hans was suspended from providing investment advisory services by State of California
SEC alleges they traded contrary to client instructions investing client funds in thinly-traded bank stock
Sisu and Timothy Overturf received at least 2 million dollars in payments from clients while acting contrary to their interests
Timothy Overturf received approximately 858000 dollars in owner draws and loans from the company from 2017 to 2019
Hansueli Hans Overturf is Timothy Overturf father
Hans Overturf grew up in Switzerland and completed apprenticeship with postal service in Zurich starting 1989
Hans Overturf served in Swiss Armed Forces rising to rank of First Lieutenant leading platoon of 43 troops
Hans Overturf attended Humboldt State University graduated 1999 degree Economics Summa Cum Laude
Hans Overturf was hired by Morgan Stanley in Eureka CA as financial advisor and received National Directors Award
Hans Overturf established financial services practice through Raymond James Financial Services in Arcata CA in July 2003
Hans Overturf opened Overturf Financial Services Inc with branches in Arcata Mill Valley and San Francisco California

Hans Overturf was arrested March 2004 by Del Norte County Sheriff alongside John Russavage and Michael Harder for bilking elderly Crescent City couple with dementia out of 730000 dollars invested in Redwood Parks Lodge
Hans Overturf agreed to pay 420000 dollars of the 730000 invested and criminal charges were dropped August 2004
Redwood Parks Lodge Co venture to build luxury lodging near Redwood National Park in Orick created 2002 owned 66 acres near Elk Meadow Prairie Creek
Hans Overturf was suspended by State of California from acting as investment advisor in 2011
FINRA suspended and fined Hans Overturf 10000 dollars in 2011 for engaging in undisclosed business activities
Hans Overturf was suspended again by State of California from 2017 to December 7 2019
Hans Overturf used email signatures identifying himself as Trader and Head of Business Development at Sisu Capital
Hans Overturf now lives in Switzerland as of 2023
Hans Overturf referred many of his personal investment advisory clients to his son Sisu Capital
Hans Overturf represented himself Pro Se in the SEC lawsuit
Timothy Overturf purchased the Arcata Theatre Lounge in August 2019 with business partner Joseph Ostini
Theatre purchase made under Joseppis LLC newly formed company
Arcata Theatre Lounge purchased for 1135000 dollars originally listed 1850000 dollars in 2016
Joseph Ostini was 27 and Timothy Overturf was 23 at time of Arcata Theatre Lounge purchase
Arcata Theatre Lounge is a historic 1938 Art Deco theatre at 1036 G St Arcata California
NLRB ordered Arcata Theatre Lounge to offer bartender Rebecca Maynard her job back after Timothy Overturf fired her October 7 2021 for complaining about tipping policy
Judge Gerald Etchingham found ATL violated Section 8(a)(1) of the National Labor Relations Act
NLRB ruling was enforced by the Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals
Overturf told fired bartender her talking about wages brought down morale and amounted to insubordination
SEC case assigned to Judge Jacqueline Scott Corley Northern District of California
Timothy Overturf was served on August 6 2024 with answer due August 27 2024
Pre-settlement conference held September 17 2024 with Hansueli Overturf representing himself Pro Se
SEC case referred to Magistrate Judge Lisa Cisneros for settlement proceedings
Timothy Overturf posted on LinkedIn about blockchain technologies presentation at Virtual Affairs speaking about bitcoin ledgers and consensus protocols
Timothy Overturf LinkedIn posts reference cryptoMountainRocks event in Davos and sisusolution.io
Timothy Overturf had meeting with TNO Netherlands organisation in The Hague to discuss token sales and initial coin offerings
SEC complaint alleges undisclosed plan to leverage bank charter to accept crypto assets
Sisu Capital website was sisucapital.io using .io domain
Sisu Capital parent company shared executive with Sisu Extracts a California cannabis extraction company
John Figueiredo was registered financial advisor with Sisu Capital from 2015 to 2016 and is former CEO of both Sisu Capital and Sisu Extracts cannabis company
Sisu Extracts is now employee-owned cannabis company based in Humboldt County California
Hans Overturf purchased unsuitable inverse short-term volatility futures product designed for short-term trading but held for months or over a year
In 2018 the broker-dealer that held Sisu clients funds terminated its relationship with the company
Bank stock purchases were part of undisclosed plan to amass shares to propose crypto banking partnership to the bank
Timothy Overturf was difficult to serve in SEC lawsuit not served despite case filed August 2023 finally served August 6 2024

expected_risk_flags.description: SEC enforcement action for securities fraud Sections 206(1) and 206(2) of Investment Advisers Act filed August 2023
Operated investment advisory firm after state registration was revoked in January 2021
Father Hans Overturf arrested 2004 elder fraud FINRA suspension 2011 California suspension 2011 and 2017 to 2019
Allowed suspended advisor father to communicate with clients and make investment decisions while knowing about the suspension
Traded contrary to explicit client instructions purchasing bank stock when client repeatedly instructed to sell
Intergenerational pattern of financial misconduct father elder fraud 2004 FINRA violations 2011 joint SEC action 2017 to 2021
NLRB unfair labor practice retaliatory firing of bartender who complained about wages tipping policy enforced by Ninth Circuit Court of Appeals
Founded investment advisory firm at age 18 potentially as vehicle for suspended father to continue operating
Undisclosed plan to use client assets to accumulate bank shares in order to propose crypto banking business partnership
Purchased complex inverse short-term volatility products for clients and held long-term contrary to product design and client instructions
Involvement in blockchain crypto ventures sisusolution.io Davos events TNO meetings on ICOs alongside traditional investment advisory violations
Organizational ties between Sisu Capital and cannabis company Sisu Extracts through shared executive John Figueiredo
Timothy Overturf was difficult to serve in SEC lawsuit not served despite case filed August 2023 finally served August 6 2024
